attributes.action: Abolish hospital car parking charges for nurses
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The Nursing Times is campaigning for an end to parking charges for nurses in England. Unlike nurses in Scotland and Wales, where hospital parking charges are largely being phased out, most nurses and other NHS staff in England currently have to pay to park at their place of work. Therefore a postcode lottery exists. Equally, few private sector staff and other public sector employees, such as teachers, have to pay to park at work.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "Abolish hospital car parking charges for nurses."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page19841


Prime Minister's Office
